title: cyber-i
author: cyber-i
content: Hey all,Is there a DEX with an orderbook? A DEX where you can place an actual limit order?

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: For the ETH network, here you go.https://trade.dydx.exchange/trade/btc-usdNote that the DEX however only serves tokens on one network. That means you'll use the wrapped-tokens version if it's a coin (not the original coin). Be careful.

comments.author: cyber-i
comments.body: Quote from: rat03gopoh on December 03, 2022, 05:42:11 AMFor the ETH network, here you go.https://trade.dydx.exchange/trade/btc-usdNote that the DEX however only serves tokens on one network. That means you'll use the wrapped-tokens version if it's a coin (not the original coin). Be careful.I checked this dex, but it seems it has only perpetual futures.Is there any dex with spot trading?

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: cyber-i on December 03, 2022, 09:39:35 AMIs there any dex with spot trading?That's a lot bro, it depends what network you wanna trade, have you checked on https://coinmarketcap.com/rankings/exchanges/dex?Some have an orderbook feature, such asBSC https://trade.orionprotocol.io/Solana https://dex.raydium.io/ETH https://forkdelta.app/Multinetwork https://helixapp.com/Stellar https://www.stellarx.com/

comments.author: cyber-i
comments.body: I want to trade on ETH / ERC20 tokens primarily.From your list I see only Forkdelta for ETH, but it seems to not be active anymore. No trading data on CMC or anywhere else.Helix has multichain but only $200k volume.

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: Quote from: cyber-i on December 03, 2022, 03:46:20 PMI want to trade on ETH / ERC20 tokens primarily.Well, I can't think of any right now but one of the usual dex that I use when it's come to buying erc20 tokens is Uniswap but yeah it doesn't have orderbook.Quote from: cyber-i on December 03, 2022, 03:46:20 PMFrom your list I see only Forkdelta for ETH, but it seems to not be active anymore. No trading data on CMC or anywhere else.Forkdelta has been almost dead long time ago. And mostly, the tokens listed there aren't that much to be taken care of as liquidity isn't that much there.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: cyber-i on December 03, 2022, 03:46:20 PMI want to trade on ETH / ERC20 tokens primarily.2018 then I got to know IDEX for ERC20 network (iirc I only traded once). Only need your external wallet connected. Recently I checked the site is still active but with a lot of changes in appearance.Not a recommendation, if you decide to use it please DYOR first.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: There’s loopring.io I’ve seen in the subreddits. I can’t vouch for it but it’s on the official webite.Note that these DEXes aren’t actually decentralized but hybrids which took bits from both worlds - decentralized and centralized.

comments.author: electronicash
comments.body: you can check it out in this list where it says orderbook type https://coinmarketcap.com/rankings/exchanges/dex/  dydx i think it the top option since you only want to trade ETH. you could actually just use swap after all what you wanna trade is ERC20 compare to real BTC/USDT which means an order book that has real BTC. there are several dex that you don't have to receive wrapBTC or the likes of it.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Unfortunately, high liquidity and volumes are with the swap dexes (the ones with the AMM mechanism) so you will end up with  wide spread in Old-School dexes that have order books.You might wanna try1. Loopring (https://loopring.io/#/trade/pro/LRC-ETH)2. Apollo dex (https://www.apollox.finance/en/trade/APX_USDT) (only 4 spot trading pairs)3. stellarterm.com (https://stellarterm.com/exchange/XLM-native/USDC-www.centre.io)4. helixapp.com (https://helixapp.com/spot/inj-usdt)

comments.author: buwaytress
comments.body: Wow, this made me look back at Counterparty and Waves, the only DEXs I'd ever used prior to all the ERC20 ones that came out in the years after.Looks like both virtually don't exist -- 90-day volume of $50 on Counterparty while Waves says it is no longer supported.Wonder if any non-EVM DEXs are still around, I suppose you could still do BTC DEX on Counterparty, just need to advertise the order.

comments.author: honglu69
comments.body: AtomicDEX from Komodo uses atomic swap technology and this dex has order book inside the komodo wallet.  AtomicDEX mainly support UTXO coins like BTC LTC DOGE etc,  but it support BNB  ETH recently.  The issue of this dex is that liquidity is small so that it works well for small traders only, may not work for large traders that requires huge liquidity.

comments.author: dansus021
comments.body: https://app.1inch.io/#/1/classic/limit-order/WETH/DAI example 1nch now also has limit orderbook. But personally Im using https://idex.io/ on polygon but volume of Decentalized Exchange like this is very small so use it with caution like spread etc.
